title: Proposed Order Figueroa Law Group

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Proposed Order Figueroa Law Group
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Any proposed order submitted by the Figueroa Law Group via the electronic portal for review by Judge Jessica Recksiedler  from 11/1/2022-3/1/2023.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Michael Locke

title: EOUSA records, Louis Eppolito and Stephen Caracappa

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: EOUSA records, Louis Eppolito and Stephen Caracappa
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All records mentioning or concerning Louis Eppolito and Stephen Caracappa, a pair of NYPD detectives prosecuted as hitmen for hire by La Cosa Nostra. Both Eppolito and Caracappa are widely reported as deceased (please see attachment); as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act.

To assist in identifying records, the following is known of Eppolito:

First 5 Digits of SSN: 129-36
BOP Registration Number: 04596-748
Date of Birth: 7/22/1948
Date of Death: 11/03/2019

To assist in identifying records, the following is known of Caracappa:

First 5 Digits of SSN: 115-32
BOP Register Number: 04597-748
Date of Birth: 11/12/1941
Date of Death: 04/08/2017

If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Office has no other copies of said records.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

title: Donald Barr

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Donald Barr
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records relating to, mentioning, or generated as a result of investigation into Donald Barr (August 8, 1921 – February 5, 2004). Proof of death is not required as his death was widely reported: https://www.nytimes.com/2004/02/10/nyregion/donald-barr-82-headmaster-and-science-honors-educator.html. Records are likely to exist on Barr as he was nominated in 1983 to be part of the National Council on Educational Research, a now-defunct body of the Department of Education.

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records for all relevant names, individuals, agencies and companies. This is also to include any responsive records held in offsite locations, such as the Alexandria Records Center. Please include both investigatory and non-investigatory records in your search. If any potentially responsive records have been destroyed and/or transferred to NARA, then I request copies of the destruction or transfer slips as well as any other documentation relating to, mentioning or describing said transfer or destruction, to include but not be limited to confirmation that the Bureau has no other copies of said records. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Paul Galante

If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: Food Inspection Reports -- 2018 to 2023

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Food Inspection Reports -- 2018 to 2023
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

A listing of all food inspections conducted by the Arkansas Department of Health from 1/1/2018 to the present. In particular, I request a spreadsheet, database, or delimited text file(s) — not paper records or a PDF created from data — with the following columns/fields/variables:
- establishment name
- license/permit number
- establishment address
- establishment city/state
- establishment zip code
- establishment type
- permit holder
- inspection reason
- risk category
- The establishment's rating (in compliance, out of compliance, not observed, or not applicable) for each of the 29 risk factors and 28 good retail practices listed on the Food Establishment Inspection Report form, including whether any issue was corrected on site during inspection and/or was a repeat violation.
- If applicable, the item number, code violated, priority level, comment, and correct by date of any observations and corrective actions. 
- all temperature observations
- inspection visit date
- person in charge at establishment during the inspection
- full legal name of the inspector
- time in and out of inspection

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Ben Goehring

title: Nassau County, NY 2022 Democratic Governor Results (New York State Board Of Elections)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Nassau County, NY 2022 Democratic Governor Results (New York State Board Of Elections)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Shapefiles of election precincts in Nassau County for the 2022 gubernatorial Democratic primary

A electronic data file that can be easily read by modern computers, such as a comma-separated values file or Excel document, with the certified precinct-level election results in Nassau County for the 2022 Democratic primary for governor. ASCII files do not meet the requirements of this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

As you know, the Freedom of Information Law requires that an agency respond to a request within five business days of receipt of a request. Therefore, I would appreciate a response as soon as possible and look forward to hearing from you shortly. If for any reason any portion of my request is denied, please inform me of the reasons for the denial in writing and provide the name and address of the person or body to whom an appeal should be directed. 

Sincerely,

Tyler Brechner

title: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Personnel and disciplinary records, subject: fmr. Police Officer Yoheliza Yanez

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Personnel and disciplinary records, subject: fmr. Police Officer Yoheliza Yanez
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Personnel and the complete disciplinary record of former Police Officer Yoheliza Yanez and all disciplinary records that identify P.O. Yoheliza Yanez as a subject. For specificity and to rule out duplicates, PO Yoheliza Yanez was arrested on October 14, 2022 in the confines of the 102 Precinct in the County of Queens, New York. 

Divisions that may hold responsive records include Internal Affairs, Employment Management, and Department Advocate's Office; however, any record used to evaluate performance toward the subject's continued employment or promotion should be considered responsive.

In accordance with the Freedom of Information Law as amended by Chapter 96 of the Laws of New York of 2020, records that may be released include "the complaints, allegations, and charges against an employee; the name of the employee complained of or charged; the transcript of any disciplinary trial or hearing, including any exhibits introduced at such trial or hearing; the disposition of any disciplinary proceeding; and the final written opinion or memorandum supporting the disposition and discipline imposed including the agency's complete factual findings and its analysis of the conduct and appropriate discipline of the covered employee."

Under precedent, Freedom of Information Law uses a "balancing test" method of weighing privacy interests favoring redaction/denial against the public interest in favor of disclosure. This matter is of clear public interest for the following reasons: P.O. Yoheliza Yanez has been publicly accused of engaging in an off-duty act of domestic violence in the County of Queens: https://qns.com/2022/10/two-off-duty-nypd-officers-cuffed-in-kew-gardens-domestic-incident/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kim Smith

communications.communication:
Your request FOIL-2023-056-06161 has been successfully submitted to the New York City Police Department (NYPD).
                                The details of your request are shown below. 
 
Request Title: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Personnel and disciplinary records, subject: 
 
Request Description: Other Request 
 
Request Type: Other Request 
 
 Other Request 
Type of Request: 
Report #: 
Date: 
Time: 
Precinct: 
Location: 
Description:
                                            
                                                To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Personnel and the complete disciplinary record of former Police Officer Yoheliza Yanez and all disciplinary records that identify P.O. Yoheliza Yanez as a subject. For specificity and to rule out duplicates, PO Yoheliza Yanez was arrested on October 14, 2022 in the confines of the 102 Precinct in the County of Queens, New York.

Divisions that may hold responsive records include Internal Affairs, Employment Management, and Department Advocate's Office; however, any record used to evaluate performance toward the subject's continued employment or promotion should be considered responsive.

In accordance with the Freedom of Information Law as amended by Chapter 96 of the Laws of New York of 2020, records that may be released include "the complaints, allegations, and charges against an employee; the name of the employee complained of or charged; the transcript of any disciplinary trial or hearing, including any exhibits introduced at such trial or hearing; the disposition of any disciplinary proceeding; and the final written opinion or memorandum supporting the disposition and discipline imposed including the agency's complete factual findings and its analysis of the conduct and appropriate discipline of the covered employee."

Under precedent, Freedom of Information Law uses a "balancing test" method of weighing privacy interests favoring redaction/denial against the public interest in favor of disclosure. This matter is of clear public interest for the following reasons: P.O. Yoheliza Yanez has been publicly accused of engaging in an off-duty act of domestic violence in the County of Queens: https://qns.com/2022/10/two-off-duty-nypd-officers-cuffed-in-kew-gardens-domestic-incident/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kim Smith

title: Martin County Public School District Removal of "The Storyteller"

communications.subject: Florida Sunshine Law Request: Martin County Public School District Removal of "The Storyteller"
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Florida Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of the objection form associated with review of the book "The Storyteller" by Jodi Picoult, as referenced in the list of book challenges published at https://www.scribd.com/document/630033537/Martin-County-School-District-Removed-Books#.

2. A copy of any response to the objection form, any appeal submitted by the objector, any response to any such appeal, or any other documents reflecting the decision to remove the book.

3. A copy of any records generated in connection with the review of "The Storyteller," including any processing notes, minutes of meetings, or emails concerning the review.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Adam Steinbaugh

communications.subject: [OpenRecords] Request FOIL-2023-056-06157 Submitted to New York City Police Department (NYPD)
communications.communication:
Your request FOIL-2023-056-06157 has been successfully submitted to the New York City Police Department (NYPD).
                                The details of your request are shown below. 
 
Request Title: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Personnel and disciplinary records, subject: 
 
Request Description: Other Request 
 
Request Type: Other Request 
 
 Other Request 
Type of Request: 
Report #: 
Date: 
Time: 
Precinct: 
Location: 
Description:
                                            
                                                To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

Personnel and the complete disciplinary record of former Police Officer Aliea Persaud and all disciplinary records that identify P.O. Aliea Persaud as a subject. For specificity and to rule out duplicates, P.O. Aliea Persaud may be identified by Shield Number 13797.

Divisions that may hold responsive records include Internal Affairs, Employment Management, and Department Advocate's Office; however, any record used to evaluate performance toward the subject's continued employment or promotion should be considered responsive.

In accordance with the Freedom of Information Law as amended by Chapter 96 of the Laws of New York of 2020, records that may be released include "the complaints, allegations, and charges against an employee; the name of the employee complained of or charged; the transcript of any disciplinary trial or hearing, including any exhibits introduced at such trial or hearing; the disposition of any disciplinary proceeding; and the final written opinion or memorandum supporting the disposition and discipline imposed including the agency's complete factual findings and its analysis of the conduct and appropriate discipline of the covered employee."

Under precedent, Freedom of Information Law uses a "balancing test" method of weighing privacy interests favoring redaction/denial against the public interest in favor of disclosure. This matter is of clear public interest for the following reasons: P.O. Aliea Persaud has been publicly accused of engaging in an off-duty act of domestic violence in the County of Queens: https://www.msn.com/en-us/news/crime/2-off-duty-nypd-officers-arrested-in-separate-domestic-violence-incidents/ar-AAZV7TS

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Kim Smith

title: FOIL: Involvement with and Influences from GARE (Tompkins County)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL: Involvement with and Influences from GARE (Tompkins County)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request records pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) (Public Officers Law Article 6) regarding the involvement of the agency with the Government Alliance on Race and Equity (GARE) or The Local & Regional Government Alliance on Race and Equity and/or an organization by the name "Race Forward" and/or an organization by the name "[the] Center for Social Inclusion" collectively referred to as GARE.

I am requesting access to any and all records, documents, communications, or other materials related to the following:

1. Any contracts or agreements between the agency and GARE or any related organizations.
2. Any training materials or presentations related to racial equity, diversity, or inclusion that the agency has used or received from GARE or any related organizations.
3. Any policies or programs related to racial equity, diversity, or inclusion that have been influenced by GARE or any related organizations.
4. Any reports, data, or other information related to the agency's efforts to promote racial equity or reduce racial disparities among students, faculty, staff, or the community at large, in collaboration with GARE or any related organizations.
5. Any meeting minutes or other records of discussions or decision-making related to the agency's involvement with GARE or any related organizations.

Please include all documents and materials from January 1, 2016, to the present.

If any portion of my request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific FOIL exemption(s) that justify the denial.

Please note that your agency/county/city were considered in scope for this FOIL request as your jurisdiction is listed on the website for a GARE organization stating that they work in your offices: https://www.racialequityalliance.org/where-we-work/jurisdictions/

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request records pursuant to the New York State Freedom of Information Law (FOIL) (Public Officers Law Article 6) regarding the involvement of the agency with the Government Alliance on Race and Equity (GARE) or The Local & Regional Government Alliance on Race and Equity and/or an organization by the name "Race Forward" and/or an organization by the name "[the] Center for Social Inclusion" collectively referred to as GARE.

I am requesting access to any and all records, documents, communications, or other materials related to the following:

1. Any contracts or agreements between the agency and GARE or any related organizations.
2. Any training materials or presentations related to racial equity, diversity, or inclusion that the agency has used or received from GARE or any related organizations.
3. Any policies or programs related to racial equity, diversity, or inclusion that have been influenced by GARE or any related organizations.
4. Any reports, data, or other information related to the agency's efforts to promote racial equity or reduce racial disparities among students, faculty, staff, or the community at large, in collaboration with GARE or any related organizations.
5. Any meeting minutes or other records of discussions or decision-making related to the agency's involvement with GARE or any related organizations.

Please include all documents and materials from January 1, 2016, to the present.

If any portion of my request is denied, please provide a written explanation for the denial, citing the specific FOIL exemption(s) that justify the denial.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jackson Parker

title: FOIL Request for Data Supporting Assumptions and Judgments in NYSED's Culturally Responsive-Sustaining Education Framework

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: FOIL Request for Data Supporting Assumptions and Judgments in NYSED's Culturally Responsive-Sustaining Education Framework
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am writing to request access to statistical tabulations and data related to the "unbalanced conditions" outlined in the Culturally Responsive-Sustaining Education Framework. Specifically, I am requesting data related to the following items:

1. Lack of access to quality education due to underfunding of schools in low-income areas
2. Discrimination based on race, gender, sexual orientation, or other factors
3. Limited opportunities for career and personal advancement for individuals from certain backgrounds
4. Lack of representation and visibility of diverse perspectives in curriculum and teaching materials
5. Implicit biases held by teachers, administrators, and other education professionals that impact student experiences and outcomes
6. Inadequate support for students with disabilities or learning differences
7. Language barriers for students and families who speak languages other than English
8. Insufficient engagement with families and communities, especially those who have historically been marginalized
9. Limited access to technology and internet connectivity for students from low-income families

I would like the data to include any assumptions or judgments made in the Culturally Responsive-Sustaining Education Framework for which the statistical tabulations and data should support.

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

title: BlueLeaks RTKs

communications.subject: New Hampshire Right to Know Law Request: BlueLeaks RTKs
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the New Hampshire Right to Know Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents, emails, memos and other records mentioning or generated in response to Right To Know requests 2020-RTK-SP-950 and 2020-RTK-SP-1343.

I am a member of the news media and request classification as such. I have previously written about the government and its activities, with some reaching over 100,000 readers in outlets such as Gizmodo, MuckRock, Motherboard, Property of the People, Unicorn Riot, and The Outline, among others. As such, as I have a reasonable expectation of publication and my editorial and writing skills are well established. In addition, I discuss and comment on the files online and make them available through non-profits such as the library Internet Archive and the journalist non-profit MuckRock, disseminating them to a large audience. While my research is not limited to this, a great deal of it, including this, focuses on the activities and attitudes of the government itself. As such, it is not necessary for me to demonstrate the relevance of this particular subject in advance.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Emma North-Best

communications.subject: Massachusetts Public Records Law Request: Training materials relating to 28 CFR Part 23 (Boston Regional Intelligence Center (BRIC))
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

A copy of any materials, including presentations, brochures, emails, images or other information, used in training fusion center employees on 28 CFR Part 23.20 ("CRIMINAL INTELLIGENCE SYSTEMS OPERATING POLICIES --- Operating principles"). DHS monitors whether fusion center employees receive training in these materials, and how often. A previous public records request (PRR B000036-010821) disclosed that such trainings have in fact occurred at the Boston Regional Intelligence Center.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Alex Marthews

title: Mandatory Declassification Review: footage of the July 31, 2022 drone strike in Kabul

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Mandatory Declassification Review: footage of the July 31, 2022 drone strike in Kabul
communications.communication:
This is a request for a mandatory declassification review (MDR), under the terms of section 3.5 of E.O. 13526, seeking the following documents:

Audio-visual recordings ("recordings") of the sensors from the unmanned aerial vehicles (henceforth "UAV's") for the targeted operation credited with the killing of Ayman al-Zawahiri, on July 31, 2022 in  Kabul, Afghanistan ("the operation"), as well as recordings of communications among participants in the operation. 

Please note:
• Video recordings may be in multiple varieties, such as different light spectra (e.g., visible light spectrum recordings from an electro-optical sensor vs. recordings of video shot from an infrared camera). All of these are of interest and should be provided in separate video files where possible.
• While recordings from the sensors of the MQ-9 Reaper drone publicly credited with the launch of missiles is of interest, I also request any footage from any separate UAV's in the operation (e.g., an Intelligence Surveillance & Reconnaissance UAV used to observe the area immediately before and after the strike).
• Any audio-video recordings from communications related to the recordings (for instance, audio of pilots and sensor operators coordinating) should also be released.

I am requesting this review and release because I believe it contains information that is of public interest and does not pose a threat to national security if released.

Please acknowledge receipt of this request and provide an estimated timetable for the review. If you have any questions or need additional information, please contact me at this email address.

Sincerely,
T. McElwee

Grace from 1967 to 2010 that contain the words “vermiculite” OR “asbestos” OR “Libby” OR "Lincoln County" OR “tremolite” OR “Zonolite” OR “amphibole” OR "anthophyllite" OR "asbestiform" OR "chrysotile" OR "actinolite" OR "amosite" OR "anthophyllite" OR "crocidolite" OR "richterite" OR "winchite"
